function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Automation and use of driverless vehicles and robots may lead to a reduction in the availability of human resources for pandemic prevention and control.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited adoption and application of 5g technology due to challenges in network structure and lack of application scenarios.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to 5g’s social and business values due to focus on technological aspects and lack of commercial usage.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on telemedicine for diagnosis and treatment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mental health impact during lockdown","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited evidence and diverse research findings","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limitations of cross-sectional study design in determining temporal relationships between variables","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited generalizability of results due to low response rate and recruitment from a single university","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interdisciplinary approach and investigation needed","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate management of individual behaviors to comply with safety requirements","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration in studying and addressing covid-19 epidemic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Intrinsic relationship between municipalities and reduced social interactions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decline in social activities due to travel restrictions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close interaction between individuals and objects in the built environment leading to the transfer of infectious diseases through surfaces and shared spaces.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor hygiene habits leading to illness and health issues","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of open relaxation spaces within the built form of houses","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unmaintained personal cleanliness leading to increased risk of disease transmission in the built environment.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for over-reliance on telemedicine and remote monitoring, leading to missed or delayed physical examinations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation, myths, and conspiracy theories about covid-19 spread through ai on social media","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to public health measures due to surveillance and tracking methods","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinformation, myths, and conspiracy theories about covid-19 leading to increased stress levels in people.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Statistically insignificant differences in social satisfaction between local and international residents may indicate underlying social disparities and unequal access to resources.","category":"Social and Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Preference for living in gated communities due to increased security and safety during pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased preference for gated communities due to safety and security concerns","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of private space in non-gated communities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Similar agreement level in non-gated and gated communities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Perception of gated communities as segregated urban form","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in social experience between gated and non-gated community residents during the pandemic","category":"Social and Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Preference for gated communities due to perceived safety during pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased popularity of gated communities in the post-pandemic era","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Perception of living in gated communities as safer without sufficient evidence","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective culture based on resilience, change management, and agile principles","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of implementing unvalidated best practices in construction projects","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited implementation of occupant health concepts in building design and construction","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration of human health knowledge into building design and operation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for human-building interactions and spatial organization","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for occupant health in building design","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited emphasis on designing, constructing, and operating buildings with occupant health and well-being as an objective","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resistance to the healthy building movement","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Scarcity of real-world cases and lack of confidence in healthy building initiatives","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Generalizing results from a sample dominated by engineers, architects, and facility managers","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential lag in academic publications compared to current trends","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding about the effect of building attributes on occupant health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of interdisciplinary collaboration in promoting occupant health","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of * for experimental/laboratory studies without specifying the building type","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clear and commonly accepted definition of ’healthy building’","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of home quarantine","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of communication due to closed balconies","category":"Social and Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social science integration in disease control policies and programs","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited attention to the pervasive co-infection in neglected tropical diseases ntds .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
